column4: i cant seem to install vlc 1.0 i added the ckorn repo and they key for it but when i try to install i get dependancy issues
did you uninstall the old on
been a while since I installed it.
try removing the repo, update, install vlc from repo and then add the repo and do a dist-upgrade?
I just removed the old one, and added repo and installed new one.  still, it should get the deps regardless of where the main package is from
looks like its still trying to use the ppa
remove it completely (autoremove --purge vlc) remove the ppa, apt-get update and install vlc again
what version of ubuntu you using?
well remove it completely, and do a find ~ -iname "*vlc*" and remove whatever is there for it.
then re-add the repo , update and install it.. I dont see what could stop it
weirdly i installed from synpatic and it worked thanks anyway :)
